enums.name: RankerKind
enums.doc: Type of ranker to be used.

enums.name: LogicalOperationKind

values.name: OR
values.doc: Set 'OR' for using corresponding logical operation.

enums.doc: Set to 'OR' or 'AND' for using corresponding logical operation.

enums.name: Scorer

values.name: Classic
values.doc: Set this value for scoring based on classic algorithms like wordnet, tfidf, ngram etc.

values.name: Transformer
values.doc: Set this value for scoring based on transformer based models.

values.name: Semantic
values.doc: Set this scorer to use AI search semantic based ranking. Semantic ranking should be configured for this to be used.

enums.doc: Type of scorer to be used

enums.name: MatchingPolicyKind

values.name: Prebuilt
values.doc: Prebuilt weights will be used for giving preference to question and answer columns when quering AI search

enums.doc: Kind of matching policy to be used

enums.name: MatchingPolicyFieldsType
enums.doc: Fields to be considred for matching policy

values.name: AzureCognitiveSearchNotFound
values.doc: Azure Cognitive Search not found error

values.name: AzureCognitiveSearchIndexNotFound
values.doc: Azure Cognitive Search index not found error

values.name: AzureCognitiveSearchIndexLimitReached
values.doc: Azure Cognitive Search index limit reached error

values.name: AzureCognitiveSearchNotFound
values.doc: Azure Cognitive Search not found error

enums.name: StringIndexType

values.name: TextElements_v8
values.doc:
Returned offset and length values will correspond to TextElements (Graphemes
and Grapheme clusters) confirming to the Unicode 8.0.0 standard. Use this
option if your application is written in .Net Framework or .Net Core and you
will be using StringInfo.

values.name: UnicodeCodePoint
values.doc:
Returned offset and length values will correspond to Unicode code points. Use
this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode,
for example Python.

values.name: Utf16CodeUnit
values.doc:
Returned offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use
this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode,
for example Java, JavaScript.

enums.doc:
Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets.  Defaults to Text
Elements (Graphemes) according to Unicode v8.0.0. For additional information
see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

models.name: AnswersOptions
models.doc: Parameters to query a knowledge base.

properties.name: qnaId
properties.doc:
Exact QnA ID to fetch from the knowledge base, this field takes priority over
question.

properties.name: question
properties.doc: User question to query against the knowledge base.

properties.name: top
properties.doc: Max number of answers to be returned for the question.

properties.name: userId
properties.doc: Unique identifier for the user.

properties.name: confidenceThreshold
properties.doc: Minimum threshold score for answers, value ranges from 0 to 1.

properties.name: answerContext
properties.doc: Context object with previous QnA's information.

type.name: KnowledgeBaseAnswerContext
type.doc: Context object with previous QnA's information.

properties.name: previousQnaId
properties.doc: Previous turn top answer result QnA ID.

properties.name: previousQuestion
properties.doc: Previous user query.

properties.name: rankerKind
properties.doc: Type of ranker to be used.

properties.name: filters
properties.doc: Filter QnAs based on given metadata list and knowledge base sources.

properties.name: metadataFilter
properties.doc: Find QnAs that are associated with the given list of metadata.

type.name: MetadataFilter
type.doc: Find QnAs that are associated with the given list of metadata.

properties.name: MetadataRecords
properties.doc: Dictionary of string

valueType.name: MetadataRecord
valueType.doc: Object to provide the key value pair for each metadata.

properties.name: key
properties.doc: Metadata Key from Metadata dictionary used in the QnA.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Metadata Value from Metadata dictionary used in the QnA.

properties.name: logicalOperation
properties.doc: Operation used to join metadata filters.

properties.name: sourceFilter
properties.doc:
Find QnAs that are associated with any of the given list of sources in
knowledge base.

properties.name: logicalOperation
properties.doc: Logical operation used to join metadata filter with source filter.

properties.name: shortAnswerOptions
properties.doc: To configure Answer span prediction feature.

type.name: ShortAnswerOptions
type.doc: To configure Answer span prediction feature.

properties.name: IsEnabled
properties.doc: Enable or disable Answer Span prediction.

properties.name: confidenceThreshold
properties.doc:
Minimum threshold score required to include an answer span, value ranges from 0
to 1.

properties.name: top
properties.doc: Number of Top answers to be considered for span prediction from 1 to 10.

properties.name: includeUnstructuredSources
properties.doc: (Optional) Flag to enable Query over Unstructured Sources.

properties.name: queryPreferences
properties.doc: To fine tune query results

type.name: QueryPreferences
type.doc: Additional properties to fine tune query results

properties.name: scorer
properties.doc: To specify what scoring algorithm is preferred

properties.name: matchingPolicy
properties.doc: Policy for controling exact query match behavior

discriminatorProperty.name: kind
discriminatorProperty.doc: Kind of matching policy to be applied

Prebuilt.name: PrebuiltQueryMatchingPolicy
Prebuilt.doc: Represents fields for Prebuilt query matching. Prebuilt weights will be used for giving preference to question and answer columns when quering AI search

properties.name: kind
properties.doc: Matching policy kind

type.name: Prebuilt

enumType.doc: Kind of matching policy to be used
enumType.name: MatchingPolicyKind

values.doc: Prebuilt weights will be used for giving preference to question and answer columns when quering AI search
values.name: Prebuilt

type.doc: Prebuilt weights will be used for giving preference to question and answer columns when quering AI search

properties.name: fields
properties.doc: List of fields to filter during query. For ex if only "questions" is used then query will be filtered on that column

properties.name: IsFullMatchingDisabled
properties.doc: Disabling full match on query. Enabling this will give preference to qna pairs that have exact match.

properties.name: answers
properties.doc: Represents Answer Result list.

properties.name: questions
properties.doc: List of questions associated with the answer.

properties.name: answer
properties.doc: Answer text.

properties.name: confidence
properties.doc: Answer confidence score, value ranges from 0 to 1.

properties.name: qnaId
properties.doc: ID of the QnA result.

properties.name: source
properties.doc: Source of QnA result.

properties.name: metadata
properties.doc:
Metadata associated with the answer, useful to categorize or filter question
answers.

properties.name: dialog
properties.doc: Dialog associated with Answer.

properties.name: isContextOnly
prompts
properties.doc: List of prompts associated with the answer.

properties.name: displayOrder
properties.doc: Index of the prompt - used in ordering of the prompts.

properties.name: Id
properties.doc: QnA ID corresponding to the prompt.

properties.name: displayText
properties.doc: Text displayed to represent a follow up question prompt.

properties.name: shortAnswer
properties.doc: Answer span object of QnA with respect to user's question.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: Predicted text of answer span.

properties.name: confidence
properties.doc: Predicted score of answer span, value ranges from 0 to 1.

properties.name: offset
properties.doc: The answer span offset from the start of answer.

properties.name: length
properties.doc: The length of the answer span.

properties.name: error
properties.doc: The error object.

type.name: Error
type.doc: The error response object returned when the service encounters some errors during processing the request.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: A human-readable representation of the error.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The target of the error.

properties.name: details
properties.doc: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

type.name: InnerErrorModel
type.doc:
An object containing more specific information about the error. As per
Microsoft One API guidelines -
https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: Error message.

properties.name: details
properties.doc: Error details.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: Error target.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc:
An object containing more specific information than the current object about
the error.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.doc: String error code indicating what went wrong.

models.name: AnswersFromTextOptions
models.doc: The question and text record parameters to answer.

properties.name: question
properties.doc: User question to query against the given text records.

properties.name: textDocuments
properties.doc: Text records to be searched for given question.

valueType.name: TextDocument
valueType.doc: Represent input text record to be queried.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: Unique identifier for the text record.

properties.name: text
properties.doc: Text contents of the record.

properties.name: language
properties.doc:
Language of the text records. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For
example, use "en" for English; "es" for Spanish etc. If not set, use "en" for
English as default.

properties.name: stringIndexType
properties.doc:
Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets.  Defaults to Text
Elements (Graphemes) according to Unicode v8.0.0. For additional information
see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

properties.name: answers
properties.doc: Represents the answer results.

properties.name: answer
properties.doc: Answer.

properties.name: confidence
properties.doc: answer confidence score, value ranges from 0 to 1.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: record ID.

properties.name: shortAnswer
properties.doc: Answer span object with respect to user's question.

properties.name: offset
properties.doc: The sentence offset from the start of the document.

properties.name: length
properties.doc: The length of the sentence.

methods.name: getAnswers
methods.doc: Answers the specified question using your knowledge base.

operation.name: getAnswers
operation.doc: Answers the specified question using your knowledge base.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.doc: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.doc: The name of the project to use.

parameters.name: deploymentName
parameters.doc: The name of the specific deployment of the project to use.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.doc: Body parameter's content type. Known values are application/json

question.value: how long it takes to charge surface?

answer.value:
Power and charging**

It takes two to four hours to charge the Surface Pro 4 battery fully from an empty state. It can take longer if youre using your Surface for power-intensive activities like gaming or video streaming while youre charging it.

You can use the USB port on your Surface Pro 4 power supply to charge other devices, like a phone, while your Surface charges. The USB port on the power supply is only for charging, not for data transfer. If you want to use a USB device, plug it into the USB port on your Surface.

**Charge your Surface Pro 4**

1.  Connect the two parts of the power cord.

2.  Connect the power cord securely to the charging port.

3.  Plug the power supply into an electrical outlet.

text.value: Power and charging. It takes two to four hours to charge the Surface Pro 4 battery fully from an empty state. It can take longer if youre using your Surface for power-intensive activities like gaming or video streaming while youre charging it.

You can use the USB port on your Surface Pro 4 power supply to charge other devices, like a phone, while your Surface charges. The USB port on the power supply is only for charging, not for data transfer. If you want to use a USB device, plug it into the USB port on your Surface.
